summary: Francoist Spain was a dictatorship led by Francisco Franco from 1936 to 1975. It began after the Spanish Civil War, and Franco ruled as a military leader and head of state. The country was officially called the Spanish State. Initially, the regime had fascist influences, but it later opened up and became more like other dictatorships. After World War II, Spain faced isolation but later experienced economic growth. Franco restored the monarchy before his death, and King Juan Carlos I led Spain's transition to democracy.
title: Francoist Spain
